segment.source: Learn how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a JavaScript/HTML app for Windows 10 (UWP), Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.
segment.target: Learn how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a JavaScript/HTML app for Windows 10 (UWP), Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.

segment.source: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript
segment.target: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript

segment.source: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript
segment.target: AdControl in HTML 5 and Javascript

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a JavaScript/HTML app for Windows 10 (UWP), Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a JavaScript/HTML app for Windows 10 (UWP), Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.

segment.source: This walkthrough does not use the AdMediatorControl or ad mediation.
segment.target: This walkthrough does not use the AdMediatorControl or ad mediation.

segment.source: For a complete sample project that demonstrates how to add banner ads to a JavaScript/HTML app, see the advertising samples on GitHub.
segment.target: For a complete sample project that demonstrates how to add banner ads to a JavaScript/HTML app, see the advertising samples on GitHub.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.

segment.source: Note If you have installed Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295 or later with Visual Studio 2015, you must also install the WinJS library.
segment.target: Note If you have installed Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295 or later with Visual Studio 2015, you must also install the WinJS library.

segment.source: This library used to be included in previous versions of the Windows SDK for Windows 10, but starting with the Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295 this library must be installed separately.
segment.target: This library used to be included in previous versions of the Windows SDK for Windows 10, but starting with the Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295 this library must be installed separately.

segment.source: To install WinJS, see Get WinJS.
segment.target: To install WinJS, see Get WinJS.

segment.source: Code development
segment.target: Code development

segment.source: In Visual Studio, open your project or create a new project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, open your project or create a new project.

segment.source: If your project targets Any CPU, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).
segment.target: If your project targets Any CPU, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).

segment.source: If your project targets Any CPU, you will not be able to successfully add a reference to the Microsoft advertising library in the following steps.
segment.target: If your project targets Any CPU, you will not be able to successfully add a reference to the Microsoft advertising library in the following steps.

segment.source: For more information, see Reference errors caused by targeting Any CPU in your project.
segment.target: For more information, see Reference errors caused by targeting Any CPU in your project.

segment.source: From the Solution Explorer window, right click References, and select Add Reference…
segment.target: From the Solution Explorer window, right click References, and select Add Reference…

segment.source: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:
segment.target: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:

segment.source: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for JavaScript (Version 10.0).
segment.target: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for JavaScript (Version 10.0).

segment.source: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for Windows 8.1 Native (JS).
segment.target: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for Windows 8.1 Native (JS).

segment.source: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 Native (JS).
segment.target: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 Native (JS).

segment.source: javascriptaddreference
segment.target: javascriptaddreference

segment.source: Note This image is for Visual Studio 2015 building a UWP project for Windows 10.
segment.target: Note This image is for Visual Studio 2015 building a UWP project for Windows 10.

segment.source: If you are building a Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1 app or using Visual Studio 2013, your screen will look different.
segment.target: If you are building a Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1 app or using Visual Studio 2013, your screen will look different.

segment.source: In Reference Manager, click OK.
segment.target: In Reference Manager, click OK.

segment.source: Open the default.html file (or other html file as appropriate for your project).
segment.target: Open the default.html file (or other html file as appropriate for your project).

segment.source: In the head section, after the project’s JavaScript references of default.css and default.js, add the reference to ad.js.
segment.target: In the head section, after the project’s JavaScript references of default.css and default.js, add the reference to ad.js.

segment.source: In a UWP project, add the following code.
segment.target: In a UWP project, add the following code.

segment.source: In a Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1 project, add the following code.
segment.target: In a Windows 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.1 project, add the following code.

segment.source: Note This line must be placed in the head section after the include of default.js; otherwise, you will encounter an error when you build your project.
segment.target: Note This line must be placed in the head section after the include of default.js; otherwise, you will encounter an error when you build your project.

segment.source: Modify the body section in the default.html file (or other html file as appropriate for your project) to include the div for the AdControl.
segment.target: Modify the body section in the default.html file (or other html file as appropriate for your project) to include the div for the AdControl.

segment.source: Assign the applicationId and adUnitId properties in the AdControl to the test values provided in Test mode values, and adjust the height and width of the control so it is one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.
segment.target: Assign the applicationId and adUnitId properties in the AdControl to the test values provided in Test mode values, and adjust the height and width of the control so it is one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You will replace the test applicationId and adUnitId values with live values before submitting your app for submission.
segment.target: You will replace the test applicationId and adUnitId values with live values before submitting your app for submission.

segment.source: Compile and run the app to see it with an ad.
segment.target: Compile and run the app to see it with an ad.

segment.source: Release your app with live ads using Windows Dev Center
segment.target: Release your app with live ads using Windows Dev Center

segment.source: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.
segment.target: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.

segment.source: For the ad unit type, specify Banner.
segment.target: For the ad unit type, specify Banner.

segment.source: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.
segment.target: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.

segment.source: In your code, replace the test ad unit values (applicationId and adUnitId) with the live values you generated in Dev Center.
segment.target: In your code, replace the test ad unit values (applicationId and adUnitId) with the live values you generated in Dev Center.

segment.source: Submit your app to the Store using the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Submit your app to the Store using the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Complete default.html for a sample UWP project
segment.target: Complete default.html for a sample UWP project
